headline.main: Illusions About Forces Keeping Italians in War

lead_paragraph: All conjectures and wishful thinking to the contrary, the American Government can harbor few illusions that at this stage of the conflict Italy can either be knocked out militarily or induced to seek a separate peace. Whatever the sentiments of the people, getting out by either route entails consequences too grim to be faced so long as the Germans command force enough to hold the Continent.
abstract: A O McCormick on Italy's dilemma

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: MEDITERRANEAN, AFRICAN, BALKAN AND NEAR EAST AREAS
